meanings.definition: The office or position of a magistrate.
meanings.sent1: In ancient times, the magistracies were responsible for upholding the law.
meanings.sent2: The city council consisted of various magistracies overseeing different aspects of governance.
meanings.sent3: The magistracies held a meeting to discuss the best way to organize the upcoming festival.
meanings.sent4: She saw the magistracies as the guardians of justice in the city.
meanings.sent5: The intricate hierarchy of magistracies ensured a fair judicial system.

meanings.sent1: The magistracies gathered to address the recent increase in crime rates.
meanings.sent2: During the ceremony, the magistracies stood in a line to welcome the new members.
meanings.sent3: It was a sight to behold when all the magistracies came together for a celebratory feast.
meanings.sent4: The unity among the magistracies was crucial in maintaining law and order.
meanings.sent5: The grand hall echoed with the voices of the magistracies as they deliberated on important matters.
